summary.long: 1 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ,
To the exiles of the dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who have been chosen and destined by God the Father and sanctified by the Spirit to be obedient to Jesus Christ and to be sprinkled with his blood:
May grace and peace be yours in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! By his great mercy he has given us a new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and into an inheritance that is imperishable, undefiled, and unfading, kept in heaven for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who are being protected by the power of God through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this you rejoice, even if now for a little while you have had to suffer various trials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the genuineness of your faith—being more precious than gold that, though perishable, is tested by fire—may be found to result in praise and glory and honor when Jesus Christ is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although you have not seen him, you love him, and even though you do not see him now, you believe in him and rejoice with an indescribable and glorious joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you are receiving the outcome of your faith, the salvation of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning this salvation, the prophets who prophesied of the grace intended for you made careful search and inquiry,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: inquiring about the time and circumstances that the Spirit of Christ within them indicated when it testified in advance to the sufferings intended for Christ and the subsequent glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was revealed to them that they were serving not themselves but you, in regard to the things that have now been announced to you through those who brought you good news by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven, things into which angels long to look!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore prepare your minds for action; discipline yourselves; set all your hope on the grace that Jesus Christ will bring you when he is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like obedient children, do not be conformed to the desires that you formerly had in ignorance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, as he who called you is holy, be holy yourselves in all your conduct,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is written, “You shall be holy, for I am holy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you invoke as Father the one who judges impartially according to each person’s work, live in fear during the time of your exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that you were ransomed from the futile conduct inherited from your ancestors, not with perishable things like silver or gold
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with the precious blood of Christ, like that of a lamb without defect or blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was destined before the foundation of the world but was revealed at the end of the ages for your sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through him you have come to trust in God, who raised him from the dead and gave him glory, so that your trust and hope are in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now that you have purified your souls by your obedience to the truth so that you have genuine mutual affection, love one another deeply from the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have been born anew, not of perishable but of imperishable seed, through the living and enduring word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For
“All flesh is like grass
    and all its glory like the flower of grass.
The grass withers,
    and the flower falls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the word of the Lord endures forever.”
That word is the good news that was announced to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rid yourselves, therefore, of all malice and all guile, insincerity, envy, and all slander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like newborn infants, long for the pure, spiritual milk, so that by it you may grow into salvation—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if indeed you have tasted that the Lord is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come to him, a living stone, though rejected by mortals yet chosen and precious in God’s sight, and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: like living stones let yourselves be built into a spiritual house, to be a holy priesthood, to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it stands in scripture:
“See, I am laying in Zion a stone,
    a cornerstone chosen and precious,
and whoever believes in him will not be put to shame.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This honor, then, is for you who believe, but for those who do not believe,
“The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the very head of the corner,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and
“A stone that makes them stumble
    and a rock that makes them fall.”
They stumble because they disobey the word, as they were destined to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, God’s own people, in order that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once you were not a people,
    but now you are God’s people;
once you had not received mercy,
    but now you have received mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, I urge you as aliens and exiles to abstain from the desires of the flesh that wage war against the soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Conduct yourselves honorably among the gentiles, so that, though they malign you as evildoers, they may see your honorable deeds and glorify God when he comes to judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord’s sake be subject to every human authority, whether to the emperor as supreme
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or to governors as sent by him to punish those who do wrong and to praise those who do right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is God’s will that by doing right you should silence the ignorance of the foolish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As servants of God, live as free people, yet do not use your freedom as a pretext for evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor everyone. Love the family of believers. Fear God. Honor the emperor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves, be subject to your masters with all respect, not only those who are good and gentle but also those who are dishonest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is a commendable thing if, being aware of God, a person endures pain while suffering unjustly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you endure when you are beaten for doing wrong, what credit is that? But if you endure when you do good and suffer for it, this is a commendable thing before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to this you have been called, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example, so that you should follow in his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He committed no sin,
    and no deceit was found in his mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was abused, he did not return abuse; when he suffered, he did not threaten, but he entrusted himself to the one who judges justly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself bore our sins in his body on the cross, so that, having died to sins, we might live for righteousness; by his wounds you have been healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you were going astray like sheep, but now you have returned to the shepherd and guardian of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, in the same way, be subject to your husbands, so that, even if some of them do not obey the word, they may be won over without a word by their wives’ conduct,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they see the purity and respect of your conduct.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not adorn yourselves outwardly by braiding your hair and by wearing gold ornaments or fine clothing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rather, let your adornment be the inner self with the lasting beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is very precious in God’s sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was in this way long ago that the holy women who hoped in God used to adorn themselves by being subject to their husbands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Sarah obeyed Abraham and called him lord. You have become her daughters as long as you do what is good and never let fears alarm you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, in the same way, show consideration for your wives in your life together, paying honor to the woman—though the weaker vessel, they are joint heirs of the gracious gift of life—so that nothing may hinder your prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, all of you, have unity of spirit, sympathy, love for one another, a tender heart, and a humble mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not repay evil for evil or abuse for abuse, but, on the contrary, repay with a blessing. It is for this that you were called—that you might inherit a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For
“Those who desire to love life
    and to see good days,
let them keep their tongues from evil
    and their lips from speaking deceit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let them turn away from evil and do good;
    let them seek peace and pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,
    and his ears are open to their prayer.
But the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now who will harm you if you are eager to do what is good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if you do suffer for doing what is right, you are blessed. Do not fear what they fear, and do not be intimidated,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in your hearts sanctify Christ as Lord. Always be ready to make your defense to anyone who demands from you an accounting for the hope that is in you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet do it with gentleness and respect. Maintain a good conscience so that, when you are maligned, those who abuse you for your good conduct in Christ may be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is better to suffer for doing good, if suffering should be God’s will, than to suffer for doing evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ also suffered for sins once for all, the righteous for the unrighteous, in order to bring you to God. He was put to death in the flesh but made alive in the spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which also he went and made a proclamation to the spirits in prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who in former times did not obey, when God waited patiently in the days of Noah, during the building of the ark, in which a few, that is, eight lives, were saved through water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And baptism, which this prefigured, now saves you—not as a removal of dirt from the body but as an appeal to God for a good conscience, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has gone into heaven and is at the right hand of God, with angels, authorities, and powers made subject to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since, therefore, Christ suffered in the flesh, arm yourselves also with the same intention (for whoever has suffered in the flesh has finished with sin),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so as to live for the rest of your time in the flesh no longer by human desires but by the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have already spent enough time in doing what the gentiles like to do, living in debauchery, passions, drunkenness, revels, carousing, and lawless idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are surprised that you no longer join them in the same excesses of dissipation, and so they blaspheme.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will have to give an accounting to him who stands ready to judge the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the reason the gospel was proclaimed even to the dead, so that, though they had been judged in the flesh as everyone is judged, they might live in the spirit as God does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The end of all things is near; therefore be serious and discipline yourselves for the sake of your prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above all, maintain constant love for one another, for love covers a multitude of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be hospitable to one another without complaining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like good stewards of the manifold grace of God, serve one another with whatever gift each of you has received.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever speaks must do so as one speaking the very words of God; whoever serves must do so with the strength that God supplies, so that God may be glorified in all things through Jesus Christ. To him belong the glory and the power forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery ordeal that is taking place among you to test you, as though something strange were happening to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But rejoice insofar as you are sharing Christ’s sufferings, so that you may also be glad and shout for joy when his glory is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are reviled for the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the spirit of glory, which is the Spirit of God, is resting on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, a thief, a criminal, or even as a mischief maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet if any of you suffers as a Christian, do not consider it a disgrace, but glorify God because you bear this name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time has come for judgment to begin with the household of God; if it begins with us, what will be the end for those who do not obey the gospel of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And
“If it is hard for the righteous to be saved,
    what will become of the ungodly and the sinner?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, let those suffering in accordance with God’s will entrust their lives to a faithful Creator, while continuing to do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as an elder myself and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, as well as one who shares in the glory to be revealed, I exhort the elders among you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to tend the flock of God that is in your charge, exercising the oversight, not under compulsion but willingly, as God would have you do it, not for sordid gain but eagerly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lord it over those in your charge, but be examples to the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief shepherd appears, you will win the crown of glory that never fades away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the same way, you who are younger must be subject to the elders. And all of you must clothe yourselves with humility in your dealings with one another, for
“God opposes the proud
    but gives grace to the humble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humble yourselves, therefore, under the mighty hand of God, so that he may exalt you in due time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast all your anxiety on him, because he cares for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Discipline yourselves; keep alert. Like a roaring lion your adversary the devil prowls around, looking for someone to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Resist him, steadfast in your faith, for you know that your brothers and sisters in all the world are undergoing the same kinds of suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after you have suffered for a little while, the God of all grace, who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ, will himself restore, support, strengthen, and establish you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him be the power forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through Silvanus, whom I consider a faithful brother, I have written this short letter to encourage you and to testify that this is the true grace of God. Stand fast in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your sister church in Babylon, chosen together with you, sends you greetings, and so does my son Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Greet one another with a kiss of love.
Peace to all of you who are in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator
